climbs.name: Sex Never did this to my hands
climbs.fa: Paul Piana, Paul Muehl & Bob Archbold  Sept 1, 1979

content.description:
Sex Never Did This to My Hands, is a beautiful Diagonal Crack. Starts on the South East Corner of Vertigo View. Climb to an Overhang and then move left to the face and the Diagonal Crack. Deep Wide Arm Crack.  

  Great Route that gives a challenge for both the lead and second. Fantastic Diagonal.  

  MAKE SURE YOU TAPE UP FOR THIS ONE. THE NAME HAS A REASON BEHIND IT...
content.protection: You are going to need a lot of 2.5" plus gear to send this route. Break out those Hexes and Big Bros for this one. It takes gear great I just needs to be large gear.
content.location: This route is located on the South East Corner of Vertigo View. When you are in the Outlets hike the trail that takes you to the North Side of the Inner Outlet. Past Classic Crack. From there the trail goes down a steep trail and Vertigo View is out your left (North Side of Trail). You can begin to see the Diagonal Crack moving up to the left. The Belay/start of the route is on the lower end of Vertigo View.

climbs.name: Popping Cherries Not Berries
climbs.fa: Mark Rafferty, Ryan Emery, and David Smith 10/2/16 Ground Up

content.description: Sling one of the many horns on the ledge at the base of climb for belayer. Climb directly up from your belayer following the two bolts seen down low. Merge towards right side of the arete on positive holds to a steep bulge. Crux is pulling the bulge. Follow low angle crimps to another steep face for the top out. Single rope (70m) rap off North side will just barely get you to the ground.
content.location: Route is located on the North West arete of formation. Start at the base of Lander Turkey Shoot and look left. Walk/stem up a thin gully til you reach the base of the arete on a ledge. From here you will be able to see two bolts.

content.description: Long knubbly face climb.  Typical of the needles. Climb to a ledge about 8 feet up then follow bolts up past a bulge to a crystalline hollow then to top.  Did this in 84 so I vaguely remember anything about it.  Feel free to add anchors to the top if it makes getting down any easier.
content.location: On the SW corner of Verigo View.  It would be on your left if you were going to the base of the Inner Outlets rappel route.

content.description: This long fin of rock is located between inner outlet and outer outlet. Vertigo view is the rock that lies between classic crack from nick of time. The rock has two sides with the majority of the climbing on the side closest to the inner outlet side.
